page.title: 09SELF SUFFICIENCY/CLANFIELD
page.content: Recent concern about the use of chemical fertilisers, with the possible adverse effects on our health has prompted farmers and gardeners to produce food by more natural means.The East Hants Self Sufficiency Group is a local branch of the Henry Doubleday Research Association,the largest body of organically minded farmers and gardeners in Britain.Their aims are to interest and inform people about the keeping of livestock and about fruit and vegetable growing by organic means.Talks and demonstrations are arranged on skills such as cheese making,spinning,weaving,butchery,and pottery.Exhibitions are held which attract many visitors who are able to purchase livestock and organically grown produce.Information on land management,greenhouse work,natural energy and related items is available.
